CEO of Shortcut Ventures GmbH in Hamburg, Germany.

Thorsten Rehling is one of the CEOs of the venture capital firm, Shortcut Ventures, located in Hamburg, Germany. Rehling received a degree in Engineering at the University of Siegen, and in 1998, he completed his MBA at the Haas School of Business (UC Berkeley).

In 1999, he set up handy.de, which became Europeâ€™s largest provider of mobile entertainment services with business partners Martin Ostermayer and Dirk Freise. They also created blau.de, the first independent wireless service discounter in Germany, in 2005. They led the company until 2011.
